Package adsouza.shapes

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • adsouza.shapes.Shape
      • adsouza.shapes.Shape2D
        • adsouza.shapes.Circle
  • public class Circle
extends Shape2D
    This class represents a simple Ellipse. It can perform common calculations relevant to a Circle's attributes and can draw a delineation of an Ellipse to Processing PApplet
    Version:
    10/26/2018
    Author:
    D'Souza

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Circle()
      Creates a default Circle object with all dimensions and attributes of this circle set to 0.
      Circle​(double x, double y, double width, double height, int r, int g, int b)
      Creates a custom Circle object at the location (x,y) with the width and height inscribed in a rectangle.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double calcArea()
      Calculates and returns the area of this circle
      double calcPerimeter()
      Calculates and returns the perimeter(circumference) of this circle
      void draw​(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
      Draws a new instance of the Circle object with the corners inscribed at the top left edge of a rectangle, assuming the circle is inscribed in a Rectangle.
      double getRadius()  
      double getX()
      Returns the x-coordinate of this Shape based on which this Shape is drawn
      double getY()
      Returns the y-coordinate of this Shape based on which this Shape is drawn
      boolean isPointInside​(double x, double y)
      Checks whether the point (x,y) is inside this circle
      void setDimen​(double width, double height)
      Sets the width and height of the circle to width and height

    • Constructor Detail

      • Circle

        public Circle()
        Creates a default Circle object with all dimensions and attributes of this circle set to 0.

      • Circle

        public Circle​(double x,
              double y,
              double width,
              double height,
              int r,
              int g,
              int b)
        Creates a custom Circle object at the location (x,y) with the width and height inscribed in a rectangle. Radius and center points are calculated with respect to this Circle's height and width
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the center of the Circle
        y - y-coordinate of the center of the Circle
        width - width of the Circle
        height - height of the Circle
        r - is the amount of Red color the Circle will be filled with
        g - is the amount of Green color the Circle will be filled with
        b - is the amount of Blue color the Circle will be filled with

      • isPointInside

        public boolean isPointInside​(double x,
                             double y)
        Checks whether the point (x,y) is inside this circle
        Specified by:
        isPointInside in class Shape
        Parameters:
        x - is the x-coordinate of the point to check for inclusion
        y - is the y-coordinate of the point to check for inclusion
        Returns:
        true is the point is inside this circle or false otherwise

      • setDimen

        public void setDimen​(double width,
                     double height)
        Sets the width and height of the circle to width and height
        Parameters:
        width - is the value that will be copied into the Circle object's width instance
        height - is the value that will be copied into the Circle object's height instance

      • draw

        public void draw​(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        Draws a new instance of the Circle object with the corners inscribed at the top left edge of a rectangle, assuming the circle is inscribed in a Rectangle.
        Overrides:
        draw in class Shape
        Parameters:
        drawer - PApplet used to create a representation of the Circle object
